discourse_list.title: \xf0\x9f\x94\x8e Focus On #9: Dai Foundation Core Unit Update

content.content: Focus On #9: Dai Foundation Core Unit Update        For the 9th episode of Focus On, we will host the Dai Foundation Core Unit to provide an update on their operations, and facilitate a discussion of current topics facing the DAO. The Dai Foundation Core Unit’s mandate is to safeguard Maker’s intellectual property. Protection, as well as transparency and accessibility to Maker’s assets both fall within scope for this core unit. A major update the Dai Foundation Core Unit is excited to share with the community is the work invested into identifying new board members for the Danish Foundation, and the requirements to be a board member. This discussion will be led by:   Søren Peter Nielsen, DAIFCU Facilitator @sorenpeter   Hans Henrik Hoffmeyer, Dai Foundation Board member @hhhoffme   Payam Samarghandi, Dai Foundation Board member @Payam   The MakerDAO community is invited to learn more about the Dai Foundation, ask questions, and provide feedback on areas of improvement within the Core Unit’s operations. Joins us for this discussion and Q&A.  Join us!  @juan & @retro will host.  When Time in your local-timezone format: 2022-04-13T15:00:00Z Mark it on your Google Calendar!  Where New Call Platform! Crowdcast call   crowdcast    Focus On #9: Dai Foundation Update Register now for Focus On #9: Dai Foundation Update on crowdcast, scheduled to go live on April 13, 2022, 10:00 AM CDT.      Attn:  @SES-Core-Unit, @gov-comms-core-unit, @GovAlpha-Core-Unit, @Growth-Core-Unit, @daif-core-unit, @Protocol-Engineering, @happiness-core-unit, @Oracles-Core-Unit, @Risk-Core-Unit, @Real-World-Finance, @dux-core-unit, @starknet-core-unit, @data-insights-cu, @collateral-core-unit, @Recognized-Delegates

Focus On Call - Episode #9  April 13th, 2022  Agenda   00:00: Intro with Retro  00:36: Discussion and Questions with Søren Peter Nielsen, Hans Henrik Hoffmeyer, and Payam Samarghandi.  51:15: Outro   Video       Introduction  Retro  Agenda and Preamble 00:00  Welcome everyone to episode #9 of Focus On. I am Retro, a contributor with the Sustainable Ecosystem Scaling CU. Juan, our facilitator, joins me. Today, we are excited to host the Dai Foundation for a CU update. We are joined by the facilitator Søren Peter Nielsen and two Dai Foundation Board members, Hans Henrik Hoffmeyer and Payam Samarghandi. For other episodes of FO, please check the forum.   Discussion  Søren Peter Nielsen, Hans Henrik Hoffmeyer, and Payam Samarghandi. 00:36  Dai Foundation Update1920×1063 191 KB   Agenda1635×934 107 KB   Recap: Why Dai Foundation1633×937 146 KB   Dai Foundation1634×935 161 KB   IP includes1634×930 164 KB   Dai Foundation Core Unit1631×934 91.8 KB   Selected topics from Q1 update1633×933 95.1 KB   What is a Danish Foundation?1631×933 162 KB   What is a Danish Foundation?1632×935 116 KB   General Requirements to Board of Trustee Members1633×933 220 KB   If Appointed1632×929 172 KB   Next steps1635×935 119 KB   Ask the Board anything1634×934 74.4 KB   See more / contact1635×934 149 KB   Questions 36:28 - Tadeo: Is all the work done with Maker funding considered a public good? 38:18 - Asad Khan: How does the Foundation verify that the CUs are contributing their IP to the Foundation? What happens when a CU is offboarded? 40:47 - Tyler Rihn: Does the Dai Foundation have an opinion on a potential feature of a multi-Dai protocol? 44:25 - Tadeo: Can CU members also be board members? 48:07 - Kianga Daverington: Is there any information about the Foundation grants and application process on a website or posted publically? 49:43 - Juan: What is the best way for the community to reach out and ask questions?  Closing Comment  Juan  Outro 51:15  Thanks again, Payam, Hans, and Søren, for being here with us. It was great having you, as always. Thank you, Retro, for the great screen management, the community for attending, and the great questions. It was great having you.   Credits  Kunfu-po produced this summary.  @gala produced this summary. Everyone who spoke and presented on the call, listed in the headers.
